result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Edward Pendleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Concurrent to Minnesota sentence.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 28, 2015 by 11:30 a.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

-Participate in Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-No Contact with Tiffany Boykins, Ms. Kelly or Ms. Kennedy.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Cooperate with any correctional program, assessment and/or evaluation as directed by Agent.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follo any recommended treatment.

60 days to commence February 6, 2015 and to be served in Minnesota and run concurrent to Minnesota sentence.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA:  Michael Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Allen Edward Pendleton appeared. Case called at 10:42 a.m. ADA Nieskes states there is an agreement and makes recommendations. Has only been in contact with 1 of the 3 victims. No restitution request. Amend charge to 2nd Degree Reckless Endangering Safety. Atty Caton makes statement. 
Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one Amended charge of  - 2nd Degree Reckless Endangering Safety , def pleads GUILTY. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1. Counts 2 and 3 Dismissed read in for restitution purposes only. Restitution held open. hml

Preliminary hearing on August 7, 2014 at 09:15 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Allegra K.,  Jamonda K. or Tiffany B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
